metadata.Title: CVE-2020-7065 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: In PHP versions 7.3.x below 7.3.16 and 7.4.x below 7.4.4, while using mb_strtolower() function with UTF-32LE encoding, certain invalid strings could cause PHP to overwrite stack-allocated buffer. This could lead to memory corruption, crashes and potentially code execution.

notes.Note: sbeattie> PEAR issues should go against php-pear as of xenial

criterions.comment: php5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
